thread.title: Stone & Chalk picks Optus for ICT services
thread.title_full: Stone & Chalk picks Optus for ICT services | Business Spectator

author: Supratim Adhikari
title: Stone & Chalk picks Optus for ICT services
text:
Fintech start-up hub Stone & Chalk has signed up Optus as its key telecommunications services provider, with the telco to supply internet, managed security and managed Wi-Fi services to the facility.
Stone & Chalk, chaired by Westpac director Craig Dunn, opened its doors in August. The open source, independent, not-for-profit entity is hoping to be the central nexus for start-ups targeting the fintech space.
Alex Scandurra, CEO of Stone & Chalk said that Optus’ experience in working with some of Australia’s largest financial services and technology companies will be a key asset for the start-ups working in the hub.
“We are looking forward to working with the team on our technology and services requirements and supporting our promising start-ups by either supplying best in breed ICT services or through access to key Optus specialists, technology leaders, partners and mentors,” Mr Scandurra said
Optus already provides ICT services to the Ventura co-working space for women-led start-ups and Optus owner Singtel’s venture capital business innov8 is also involved in supporting co-working spaces like Fishburners, and start-up accelerators including BlueChilli and Pollenizer.
